background: A shipping company must decide how to transport packages using trucks and cars to minimize gas consumption, while meeting package delivery and trip constraints.
constraints: Number of truck trips is non-negative
Number of car trips is non-negative
At most MaxTruckTrips truck trips can be made
At least MinCarTripProp of all trips must be made by cars
At least MinPackages packages must be transported
objective: Minimize the total amount of gas consumed for transporting packages
description: A shipping company needs to transport packages by either truck or car. A truck can transport \param{PackageTruck} packages per trip while a car can transport \param{PackageCar} packages per trip. In addition, a truck uses \param{GasTruck} liters of gas per trip while a car uses \param{GasCar} liters of gas per trip. There can be at most \param{MaxTruckTrips} truck trips made and at least \param{MinCarTripProp} of all the trips must be made by car. The company needs to transport at least \param{MinPackages} packages. How many of each transportation should they use to minimize the total amount of gas consumed?

parameters.definition: Number of packages transported per trip by truck
Number of packages transported per trip by car
Gas used per trip by truck
Gas used per trip by car
Minimum proportion of trips made by car
Minimum number of packages to be transported
